title: [Linux] Logging into client causes me to crash
body:
When I initially installed League, maybe three days ago, I was able to log in while the game was installing for the first time. I could use the store, chat, and do anything else you would normally be able to do when updating the game. I ended up leaving it to update while I went to eat, and when I came back I was met with a bugsplat. I closed it, and tried relaunching the client; There was no update to be done, but logging in caused a bugsplat and after two more tries, I submitted one, because what harm could it do to try? I've tried various solutions from doing a complete reinstall to using the Hextech Repair Tool (which doesn't work, either if that helps anything. Just a simple "unknown error crash for that one). I've tried installing Internet Explorer when it was suggested, but other places I saw it was suggested to uninstall; of course neither worked. 

Not sure what would be needed to solve this problem other than I'm using Zorin OS(Ubuntu based), I installed with the latest .exe using wine, not POL. 

Not sure how much help I'll get as I'm using a not-officially-supported OS, but it's worth a shot I guess
